physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Aseptic necrosis of the femoral head; positive blood cultures for Brucella melitensis; very high titers of specific agglutinin antibodies (1:320); positive rose bengal test.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: In July 1991, an autologous 99mTc leukocyte scan did not show pathological uptake. In 1993, rose bengal test and agglutinin titer were negative; treatment was discontinued. Five years later, patient was asymptomatic with no signs of prosthetic loosening.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: A two-month history of hip pain and limping; cultures from proximal femoral interface positive for Brucella melitensis; histological examination showed chronic inflammation.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: At the three-year follow-up, the patient was asymptomatic with good joint function.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Progressive swelling over the left tibial osteotomy site; cultures of the exudate demonstrated growth of Brucella melitensis; cavity communicating with the knee joint containing mucopurulent exudates.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: At three-year follow-up, range of motion was from 0° to 100° with no radiographic signs of prosthetic loosening.
